newsitem.title: JAPAN: Naphtha meeting to be held June 23, 24 in Tokyo.
newsitem.headline: Naphtha meeting to be held June 23, 24 in Tokyo.

text.p: An annual open-spec naphtha conference, where Asian naphtha traders and brokers discuss terms of the open-spec contract, will be held on June 23 and 24 in Tokyo, oil product traders said on Thursday.
"Participants are expected to discuss specifications of open-spec naphtha cargoes and inspection methods of cargo quality among other things," one trader said.
At last year's meeting, restrictions on the origin of open-spec naphtha cargoes were practically abolished.
Previously, origins of open-spec naphtha cargoes were confined to east of the Suez and west of the international dateline.
Now, cargoes produced outside of the boundary, in Europe and the United States, can be traded as open-spec naphtha as long as they meet quality standards.
